summary: Corsica is an island in the Mediterranean Sea, part of France. It's the fourth-largest island in the Mediterranean and is known for its mountain range. With a population of about 355,528 (as of January 2024), it has its own regional capital, Ajaccio. Corsica was once ruled by Genoa, Italy, before becoming part of France in 1769. The famous French leader, Napoleon Bonaparte, was born here. Today, French is the official language, but Corsican, an Italian-based language, is also spoken. Corsica is less populated than other French regions.
title: Corsica
